en: 10   A Boy with a Bird, probably late 1520s (NG933)

Volume 34 of the National Gallery Technical Bulletin is dedicated to the evolution of Titian’s technique in the first part of his career, up to around 1540. This volume presents catalogue entries for 13 by Titian, four of which do not belong to the National Gallery (cats 1, 2, 3, and 13). At this time it is not possible to include extra images for those four catalogue entries.
  • 13 The Triumph of Love, c.1544-6. Ashmolean Museum, Oxford: For further information about this picture see https://artuk.org (Accessed Feb 2022)

en: NG933: Titian or Titian workshop, A Boy with a Bird, probably 1520s, Oil on canvas, (34.9 x 48.9 cm) (5347x6332px)

NG933: Titian or Titian workshop, A Boy with a Bird, photomicrograph of boy's red costume, showing red lake particles. (3120x4164px)
NG933: Titian or Titian workshop, A Boy with a Bird, photomicrograph of the boy's white sleeve, showing a broken brushstroke. (3120x4164px)

NG933: Titian or Titian workshop, A Boy with a Bird, photomicrograph of cloud on right, showing wet-in-wet painting. (3120x4164px)
NG933: Titian or Titian workshop, A Boy with a Bird, photomicrograph of paint of distant mountain, containing particles of orpiment. (3120x4164px)

NG933: Titian or Titian workshop, A Boy with a Bird, paint cross-section from the reddish brown paint in the foreground below the boy's right hand (sample taken before cleaning). At the bottom of the sample is a canvas fibre and then the red brown ground. Over this is a layer of orpiment, followed by a warm grey from the first design, and then a light red brown from the final painting. (1284x2712px)

NG933: Titian or Titian workshop, A Boy with a Bird, paint cross-section from the tree at the top edge, above the child's head. Over the orpiment and indigo layers of the first painting are at least three layers of foliage paint.E130 (2508x4164px)
